It contains around 12 grams of fibre and only 6 grams of fat in 100 grams of serving. Oats are very high in calories and prevent so many diseases such as cardiovascular problems, diabetes, cancer, blood pressure, etc.

There is various type of oats available in the market from different brand so in this article I will help you to find the best quality oats in India so that you can decide which one is best for you. I am here to help you with the best oats for weight loss in India and the best oats for weight gain in India as well.

What is Oats?

Oats are annual grasses and are used both for human and animal nutrition, in addition to other purposes. They are a commonly grown crop in the world today. Before being used as human food, they were used to feed horses and for medicinal purposes.

Oat is a widely known cereal grain and used for animal feed and as human food because of its nutritional value and added health benefits. Oats were recognized as a healthy food in the mid-1980s and then they become more popular for human nutrition.

Oats contain more soluble fibre than any other grain. Soluble fibre is the kind that dissolves in water, so the body turns it into a kind of thick, viscous gel, which moves very slowly through your body. One of the benefits is that your stomach stays fuller longer, providing satiety. Soluble fibre also slows the absorption of glucose into the body, which means you’re going to avoid those nasty sugar highs and lows.

 

Top 10 Health Benefits of Oatmeal

1. Controls Weight

As per research oats contain a beneficial compound called Beta-glucan. It helps to produce hunger-fighting hormones that decrease your appetite. Oats are rich in fibre and high in calories that make you full for a longer period.

2. Controls Blood Pressure

Oatmeal is full of nutrition and a perfect whole grain diet. Many studies prove that whole grain diets are antihypertensive which controls your blood pressure. So you can easily prevent this problem by simply adding oatmeal to your diet.

3. Keep Cholesterol Level Balanced

Oatmeal contains the highest portion of soluble fibre. As per research, with the help of soluble fibre, only a moderate level of cholesterol enters the bloodstream during digestion and that prevents the high cholesterol problem and keep your cholesterol level balanced.

4. Good for Skin Protection

Oatmeal also helps you to get glowing skin. It contains Starc which is very beneficial for the skin, It moisturizes your skin and its Russ fibrous husk exfoliates your skin and that is why oatmeal is a majorly used ingredient in skin creams and lotion.

5. Reduces Colon Cancer Risk

Oatmeal contains a high level of fibre which helps promote regularity and increases the functioning of your digestive tract and promotes good colon health. The selenium in oatmeal helps repair DNA and is linked with corresponding lower cancer risk, especially colon cancer.

6. Stabilizes Blood Sugar Level

Oatmeal also stabilizes blood sugar levels. due to high in soluble fibre and lower glycemic index, it takes time to digest which increases the time of sugar release in the bloodstream which lowers the insulin resistance that helps to prevent metabolic syndrome type 2 diabetes.

7. Improves Stamina Level

As per research, regular use of Oatmeal drastically improves your stamina. Oatmeal is high in carbs and protein that supplies enough calories in your body and you feel more energized. If you are an athlete so oatmeal is a must in your diet.

8. Enhances Immunity

Oatmeal is also enhanced your immunity and prevents your body from all infections. The beta-glucan found in oats helps boost your infection-fighting blood cells. Oats also contain selenium and zinc, two important nutrients for warding off infection.

9. Helps During Insomnia

It is also beneficial during insomnia. As per experts, oatmeal contains Melatonin and complex carbohydrate that relax your body and improve your sleep quality. Many research proves that people face less sleep disturbance if they consume oatmeal at dinner.

10. Natural Protector of Body Cells

Oatmeal is rich in antioxidants and these antioxidants are concentrated in the outer layers of the kernel. Antioxidants prevent cells from free radicals. This helps break a chain reaction that can affect other molecules in the cell and other cells in the body.

Best time to take Oats

Oats are considered a superfood so you can take them anytime but as you know that breakfast is the most important meal of the day so the best time to eat oats is Morning. Oatmeal is a whole grain and rich in fibre, eating oatmeal in the morning may help boost metabolism. It also helps the body to quickly convert food into energy.

Oatmeal is one of the foods that can help accelerate your energy levels and improve metabolic function. Because oatmeal is rich in fat and soluble fibre, it requires a lot of calories to break down, so, eating a bowl of oatmeal in the morning can help jump start your metabolism and get your day started off on the right foot.

If you are having a sleep disorder or facing disturbance while sleeping so you can use oatmeal in your dinner as well. Oats are a good natural source of melatonin, which is often taken as a sleep aid due to its ability to help regulate the body’s internal clock.

Correct method to make oats

Method 1

  • Bring 1 cup of water or milk to a boil in a small saucepan.
  • Stir in 1/2 cup of oats and reduce heat to medium
  • Add a pinch of salt or a spoon of Organic Honey, stir occasionally, for 5 minutes.
  • Remove from heat. Cover and let it stand for 2 to 3 minutes.
  • If using a microwave combine 1 cup water or milk with Oats 1/2 cup and a pinch of salt.

Method 2

  • Add 1 scoop of oats to a bowl
  • Add 1 cup hot want in it and cover it with a lid for almost 10 minutes
  • Now, add half scoop of whey protein and pinch cinnamon powder to add flavour, mix it well
  • Add some peanuts, almonds and cashews
  • Now, store it in a fridge for about 5 minutes and it’s ready.

FAQs

Is it OK to eat oats daily?
Yes you can eat oats daily,  It helps in lower blood sugar and cholesterol levels, protection against skin irritation and reduced constipation. In addition, they are very filling and have many properties that should make them a weight loss friendly food.

Is oats good for skin?
Oatmeal can soak up the excess oil on your skin and help treat acne. Its antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties help to treat dry skin and remove dead skin cells.

Can I eat oats at night?
While many of us associate oats with breakfast time, they are also the perfect evening snack. Oats are a good natural source of melatonin, which is often taken as a sleep aid due to its ability to help regulate the body’s internal clock.

Can oats increase height?
Protein-rich foods like oatmeal help in repairing bones and tissues. They also promote the creation of new tissues. According to health experts, those who wish to increase their height should consume at least 50 grams of oatmeal in breakfast on a daily basis.
